block.p: After a yearlong debate within his cabinet, President Bush proposed deep cuts in pollution from power plants and a voluntary program to slow the buildup of gases linked to global warming. Utilities and energy companies applauded, particularly because the power plant cleanup would allow trading of credits earned by companies that find ways to go beyond requirements. But environmental groups criticized Mr. Bush, saying the timetable was too stretched out and that a climate plan without a cap would not reduce emissions.
